meanings.definition: To reduce the power rating of something.
meanings.sent1: I will derate the engine to make it safer for beginners.
meanings.sent2: The technician had to derate the generator to prevent overheating.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to derate his wand's power to avoid turning the rabbit into a dragon.
meanings.sent4: She had to derate her expectations of the old car's speed.
meanings.sent5: The decision to derate the amplifier's output saved it from burning out.

meanings.definition: To lower the value or rating of something.
meanings.sent1: The store decided to derate the price of the old stock.
meanings.sent2: The appraiser had to derate the antique vase due to a small crack.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to derate the importance of the upcoming test.
meanings.sent4: The storm's damage would derate the house's value significantly.
meanings.sent5: The decision to derate the painting's authenticity shocked the art world.

meanings.definition: To decrease the capacity or performance of something.
meanings.sent1: The software update seemed to derate the computer's speed.
meanings.sent2: The new regulations would derate the factory's production output.
meanings.sent3: The prankster thought it would be funny to derate the office coffee machine.
meanings.sent4: The lack of maintenance started to derate the elevator's reliability.
meanings.sent5: The extreme weather conditions could derate the solar panels' efficiency.
